clinical_study.brief_title: Surgery for Adhesive Small Bowel Obstruction in a Defined Population: a Cohort Study
clinical_study.official_title: Surgery for Adhesive Small Bowel Obstruction in a Defined Population: a Cohort Study

brief_summary.textblock: A cohort study of patients operated for adhesive small bowel obstruction (SBO) during a five-year period

detailed_description.textblock: It is a population-based cohort study of patients operated for adhesive small bowel obstruction during a five-year period (2007-2012) in two Swedish neighboring regions. Patients were identified by a broad search of operation and ICD codes. Preoperative data as age, gender, co-morbidity, previous surgery was registered as well as mechanisms of obstruction and intraoperative data. Short and long-term complications were analyzed. Patients were followed to 31st January 2017 , last medical note or death.

secondary_outcome.description: anastomotic leaks, intraabdominal abscesses, wound dehiscence, wound infection, urinary tract infection, cardiopulmonary events, use of antibiotics, re-operation, ICU-care, death

secondary_outcome.time_frame: >30 days postoperatively until death or 31st of January, 2017
secondary_outcome.description: re-admissions for SBO, re-operations for SBO, hernias and mortality

secondary_outcome.measure: Relationships between complications and pre- and intraoperative variables
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From surgery until death or 31st of January, 2017

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing surgery due to adhesive small bowel obstructions during the time period 2007 -2011.
